* Deadline class representing a Deadline task
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param deadlineBy  The deadline date and time for the task.
assert description != null && !description.isBlank() : "Description should not be null or blank";
* Parses a string to create a Deadline task.
* The string should be in the format used for saving to a file,
* The fields are: task type ("D"), completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done),
* If the deadline is missing or incorrectly formatted, a warning is printed, and the deadline will be null.
* @param taskData The string representing the Deadline task.
* @return A Deadline object created from the string data.
assert taskData != null && !taskData.isBlank() : "Task data should not be null or blank";
assert parts.length >= 3 : "Task data should have at least 3 parts";
System.out.println("Warning: There is no date format provided");
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* The string representation includes the task type ("D"),
* completion status, description, and the deadline formatted as "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm".
* For example, a completed task might be represented as:
* @return A string representing the Deadline task.
* Converts the Deadline task into a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format includes the task type ("D"),
* completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done), description,
* For example, a saved task might be represented as:
* @return A string representing the Deadline task in file format.
* Event class representing an Event task
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description,
* @param eventFrom the start date and time of the event.
* @param eventTo the end date and time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime eventFrom, LocalDateTime eventTo) {
: "Description should not be null or blank";
: "Event start time and end time should not be null or blank";
: "Event start time must be before or equal to end time";
* Parses a string to create an Event task.
* The string should be in the format used for saving to a file,
* completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done),
* description, start date/time, and optionally, end date/time.
* If the start or end date/time is missing or incorrectly formatted,
* a warning is printed, and the respective date/time will be null.
* @param taskData The string representing the Event task.
* @return An Event task object created from the string data.
: "Task data should not be null or blank";
assert parts.length >= 4 : "Task data should have at least 4 parts";
: "Event start time must be before or equal to end time";
System.out.println("Warning: There is no date format provided.");
Event event = new Event(description, from, to);
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* The string representation includes the task type ("E"),
* completion status, description, and the event's start and end date/times
* For example, a completed event might be represented as:
* @return A string representing the Event task.
* Converts the Event task into a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format includes the task type ("E"),
* completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done),
* description, and start and end date/times
* For example, a saved event might be represented as:
* @return A string representing the Event task in file format.
* Main class which launches the application
* Parser class which helps to create a new Task object
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yyyy HHmm");
* Parses a command string to create an appropriate Task object
* If the command format is incorrect or any part of the command is invalid,
* an error message is printed and no Task object is returned
* @param command user's command string to be parsed
* @return Task object depending on the user's command
assert command != null : "Command string should not be null.";
assert !command.isEmpty() : "Command string should not be empty.";
assert !description.isEmpty() : "ToDo description should not be empty.";
assert parts.length == 2 : "Deadline command should contain '/by' separator.";
assert !description.isEmpty() : "Deadline description should not be empty.";
assert deadline != null : "Deadline date/time should be valid.";
assert parts.length == 2 : "Event command should contain '/from' separator.";
assert subParts.length == 2 : "Event command should contain '/to' separator.";
assert !description.isEmpty() : "Event description should not be empty.";
assert from != null : "Event start date/time should be valid.";
assert to != null : "Event end date/time should be valid.";
* Parses a command string to create an appropriate datetime object
* If the command format is incorrect or any part of the command is invalid,
* an error message is printed and no LocalDateTime object is returned
* @param dateTimeStr user's command string to be parsed
* @return LocalDateTime object depending on the user's command
assert dateTimeStr != null : "DateTime string should not be null.";
* Storage class which loads and saves task from the specified file
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
assert filePath != null && !filePath.trim().isEmpty() : "File path should not be null or empty.";
* Loads tasks from the file into the provided list.
* @param taskList The list to which tasks will be added.
assert taskList != null : "Task list should not be null.";
assert line != null : "Line read from file should not be null.";
assert task != null : "Parsed task should not be null.";
System.out.println("An error occurred while loading tasks from file.");
* Stores tasks from the current task list into the provided file.
* @param taskList The list to which tasks will be copied and saved into the file
assert taskList != null : "Task list should not be null.";
assert task != null : "Task in the list should not be null.";
System.out.println("An error occurred while saving tasks to file.");
* Task abstract class which is inherited from subclasses
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
assert description != null && !description.trim().isEmpty() : "Task description should not be null or empty.";
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns whether the task is marked as done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* This method sets the completion status of the task to true.
assert this.isDone : "Task should be marked as done.";
* Marks the task as not done.
* This method sets the completion status of the task to false.
assert !this.isDone : "Task should be marked as not done.";
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* This is an abstract method that must be implemented by concrete subclasses to provide
* a specific format for displaying the task.
* Converts the task to a format suitable for saving to a file.
* This is an abstract method that must be implemented by concrete subclasses to provide
* a specific format for saving the task to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in a file-compatible format.
* TaskList class helps to manage the tasks present inside the task list
* Initializes the task list as an empty ArrayList.
* Adds a Task to the list.
* @param task The Task to be added to the list.
assert task != null : "Task to be added should not be null.";
* Retrieves a Task from the list at the specified index.
* If the index is out of bounds (i.e., less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the list),
* @param index The index of the Task to retrieve.
* @return The Task at the specified index, or null if the index is out of bounds.
assert index >= 0 && index < tasks.size() : "Index should be within the bounds of the list.";
* Deletes and returns the Task from the list at the specified index.
* If the index is out of bounds (i.e., less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the list),
* this method may throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException
* @param index The index of the Task to delete.
* @return The Task that was removed from the list.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of bounds.
assert index >= 0 && index < tasks.size() : "Index should be within the bounds of the list.";
* Returns the number of Task objects in the list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the list of Task objects.
* Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return A list of tasks containing the keyword.
assert keyword != null : "Search keyword should not be null.";
* To_Do class representing a To_Do task
* Constructs a To_Do task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
assert description != null : "Description should not be null.";
* Parses a string to create a To_Do task.
* The string should be in the format used for saving to a file, with fields separated by " | ".
* The fields are: task type ("T"), completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done), and description.
* @param taskData The string representing the To_Do task.
* @return A To_Do object created from the string data.
assert taskData != null : "Task data should not be null.";
assert parts.length >= 3 : "Task data should have at least 3 parts.";
* Returns a string representation of the To_Do task.
* The string representation includes the task type ("T"), completion status, and description.
* For example, a completed task might be represented as: "[T][X] Buy groceries".
* @return A string representing the To_Do task.
assert this.getDescription() != null : "Description should not be null.";
* Converts the To_Do task into a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format includes the task type ("T"), completion status (1 for done, 0 for not done), and description.
* For example, a saved task might be represented as: "T | 1 | Buy groceries".
* @return A string representing the To_Do task in file format.
assert this.getDescription() != null : "Description should not be null.";
* Main class which represents the JavaFX GUI for the chatbot.
private static final String HOME = System.getProperty("user.home");
private static final String DIRECTORY_PATH = HOME + "/Documents/";
private static final String FILE_PATH = DIRECTORY_PATH + "TaskInfo.txt";

* Processes the user's command and returns the relevant response.
assert command != null : "Oops! The command shouldnt be null.";
response = "Farewell! Ill be here when you need me. ";
* Checks the type of the command entered by the user.
* Removes task and shows deleted task.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
* @return the message of the deleted task.
assert command.startsWith("delete") : "Oh dear! The command should start with 'delete'.";
assert taskIndex >= 0 && taskIndex < taskList.size() : "The task index seems to be out of bounds!";
return "Oopsie! Thats not a valid task index.";
* Marks task as done and shows the marked task to user.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
* @return the message of the marked task.
assert command.startsWith("mark") : "Oops! The command should start with 'mark'.";
assert taskIndex >= 0 && taskIndex < taskList.size() : "Hmm, that task index is not valid.";
return "Oh dear, that's not a valid task index.";
* Marks task as not done and shows the unmarked task to user.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
* @return the message of the unmarked task.
assert command.startsWith("unmark") : "Oops! The command should start with 'unmark'.";
assert taskIndex >= 0 && taskIndex < taskList.size() : "The task index seems a bit off.";
return "Oopsie daisy! That index doesnt look right.";
* Finds specific task(s) from the task list based on the user keyword.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
* @return the message of the task to find.
assert command.startsWith("find") : "Oops! The command should start with 'find'.";
return "Oops! You forgot to enter your search keyword. ";
* Adds desired task to the task list and shows added task to user.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
* @return the message of the added task.
assert command != null && !command.trim().isEmpty() : "Oh no! The command cant be empty.";
* Parses the task index from the command string.
* @param command The command string containing the task index.
* @return the parsed task index, or -1 if the index is invalid.
* Shows an error message to user based on the invalid command.
* @param command entered by the user in the command box.
assert command != null : "The command shouldnt be null!";
return "Oops! The todo task description cant be empty. Give me something to work with!";
return "Oops! Your deadline task description is missing! Also, please use the dd/MM/yyyy HHmm format.";
return "Oops! Your event task description is missing! "
+ "Also, use the dd/MM/yyyy HHmm format for the timings.";
return "Oops! That command doesnt seem right. "
* Displays a goodbye message to the user.
* The application will exit 3 seconds after the message.
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added.
* Shows the details of the added task and the updated size of the task list.
* @param tasklistSize updated number of tasks in the list.
* @return the formatted message of the added task.
public String showTaskAdded(Task task, int tasklistSize) {
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
assert tasklistSize > 0 : "Task list size should be greater than 0";
return "Great! Ive added this task: " + task
+ "\nYou now have " + tasklistSize + " tasks in your list. ";
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been removed.
* Shows the details of the removed task and the updated size of the task list.
* @return the formatted message of the removed task.
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
return "Done! Ive removed this task: " + task
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* Marks the provided task as done and shows its updated status.
* @return the formatted message of the marked task.
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
return "Hooray! Ive marked this task as done: " + task;
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done yet.
* Marks the provided task as not done and shows its updated status.
* @return the formatted message of the unmarked task.
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
return "No worries! Ive marked this task as not done yet: " + task;
* Displays the list of tasks to the user.
* Shows all tasks in the provided TaskList with their corresponding index.
assert taskList != null : "Task List should not be null";
.reduce("Here are the fabulous tasks in your list:\n", (acc, taskStr) -> acc + taskStr + "\n");
* Filters out the tasks from the list which match the user keyword.
* Displays all the relevant search results from the task list.
* @param tasks is the task list to be searched.
assert tasks != null : "Task List should not be null";
return "No tasks found that match your search. Maybe try a different keyword?";
.reduce("Here are the search results for you:\n", (acc, taskStr) -> acc + taskStr + "\n");
